dcterms:creator: P. Brodatz
dcterms:description: The Brodatz dataset consists of synthetic images collected from the Brodatz book. This dataset is widely used in computer vision literature as a benchmark for evaluating methods of texture recognition. Each image has 200 × 200 pixels size with 256 gray levels. A total of 110 classes, with 10 samples each, were used.
dcterms:title: Brodatz

dcterms:creator: R. W. Picard
T. P. Minka
dcterms:description: The Vistex dataset contains 864 samples of real-world textures. This dataset includes textures captured in different combinations of illumination, orientation, and plane perspectives. Each image has 128 × 128 pixels with 256 gray levels. A total of 54 texture classes, each containing 16 samples, were used in the experiments.
dcterms:title: Vistex
